children.subject: Yes, but please be sure to tell me immediately if you chose not to accept so we do not accidentally keep you in our records
If we get accepted, because we get provided with another opportunity (CSM for example), is it possible to reject the offer?
Unfortunately AIs are required to take the class for at least 1 unit, which you would likely not be able to as a non student, so the answer is no.
<md>I believe I can register to concurrently enroll for the Fall semester. I'm just wondering if it's like a class that I register for. </md>
Yes it is, in that case you should be good to go.
<md>Thank you!</md>

<md>I'm currently a community college student in the Bay Area, and I've taken 2 CS classes at Berkeley (taking 61BL right now this summer). Would it be possible for me to volunteer to be an AI despite not being a Berkeley student?</md>
Yes, the program will be facilitated entirely online. Do note however all times will be written in PDT / PST
Are we eligible to AI if we are studying internationally?

You will be provided with the same starter code students are and will be expected to complete assignments so you can help them. I have not yet decided on a policy of exactly what autograder score will be required, but you will also get additional video walkthroughs and help to make things more reasonable
Can you expand on this?: Regularly submit assignments to the autograder (these are the same assignments students will be completing).
No. I will be providing more resources to interns than to students and it would not be fair

I'm taking CS 61B in the fall but I already know all the concepts from previous internship/work experience and enrichment courses online (I took a few sample midterms and I scored very well on them). Can I still apply as an AI?
You will add the class like you would any other, so the drop deadline is the same as all other classes.

is there a drop deadline for this? or can we not drop it like a class? 

Thanks
Unfortunately we cannot allow people to just drop in at their leisure to help. You need to be able to make the time commitment in order to be in the intern program

Is the time commitment to this strictly required? What if you fail to meet the hours needed? 

I am already enrolled in a lot of units, so I really don't need the 1 or 2 units. Yet I still want to drop in OH/Lab and help in order to strengthen my own knowledge of the course content, if time permits.
P. But also I really don't care much about your grade that is the last thing we will be evaluating you on in the application
If I PNP'd the class in Spring 2020 but know what letter grade I should have received, what should I put for the letter grade section?
The post indicates that decisions will be made by Sunday.
Alex, if we haven't heard back from the 61b email by now does that mean we weren't selected?
Does anyone know about the 61B AI application for Spring 2021?

history.content:
Hello!

 

Would you like to pass some of your computer science knowledge down to others? Would you like to better your grip on fundamental CS material? Would you like to take your first steps toward joining the CS 61B course staff? If logical-or-ing your answers to the above questions == true, please consider becoming an Academic Intern for CS61B Fall 2020!

 

As an intern you will help facilitate labs and office hours by helping students with their assignments and conceptual understanding of the class. We will be dividing interns into two main groups, but all interns share some basic responsibilities:

 

All interns will be expected to:

  • Attend a pre-semester and post-semester meeting to talk about the program / instructing students.

  • Have a one half hour mid-semester meeting with your mentor TA and their other mentees.

  • Regularly submit assignments to the autograder (these are the same assignments students will be completing).

  • Fill out mid-semester / post-semester surveys.

  • Attend 80% of your required labs / office hours. There will be some make up opportunities available.

 

We will divide interns into two categories: Lab Interns and Office Hour Interns. As an intern you will choose one of these options. 

 

1. Lab Intern: In addition to the all intern expectations above, you will be expected to:

  • Attend one two-hour lab a week.

    • The lab will be made available to you well in advance and will be accompanied by a walkthrough video. You are required to complete it and submit it to Gradescope in preparation for your lab.

 

2. Office Hours Intern: In addition to all the intern expectations above, you will be expected to:

  • Attend two Office Hours a week.

    • You will be responsible for helping students with homeworks and projects. Homeworks will be made available to you in advance with a companion walkthrough video like labs. We will most likely not provide AI-specific walkthrough videos for projects, although some guides from previous semesters exist.

    • You will be expected to make autograder submissions for all these assignments beforehand. Because there are fewer homeworks and projects than labs, you can expect more work to be put into preparing each assignment with fewer assignments overall.

  • Note: We only recommend taking this option if you have past experience with at least some of this semester’s projects (NBody, ArrayDeque, BearMaps, BYOW). If you do not they will likely far exceed your allotted one hour a week of prep.

 

For your time and effort as an Intern, you will be awarded 1 or 2 unit(s) of PNP credit for the Fall 2020 semester (if you would like 2 units, you will have double duties in either the Lab Intern or Office Hours Intern categories but the All Intern requirements will remain the same).

 

The Application is Available Here, it is due Tuesday, August 18, at 11:59pm PDT. Expect decisions by the following Friday. Due to high application volume I am switching this to Sunday.

The time for the application how now passed! You can still submit, however the longer you wait to do so the less likely are to be able to evaluate your application.

 

Please comment here with any further questions
